title: Vocational Education and Training Sector visa (subclass 572)
summary: This page provides information for people who currently hold or previously applied for the Vocational Education and Training Sector visa (subclass 572), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2016. It explains visa validity, rights, obligations, work conditions, and requirements for education provider changes and welfare arrangements for students under 18. It also outlines responsibilities for family members holding dependent visas.

visa_information.visa_name: Vocational Education and Training Sector visa
applicable_individuals: People who have already been granted a subclass 572 visa
People who applied for a subclass 572 visa on or before 30 June 2016 and whose application has not yet been decided
visa_information.rights_and_obligations_reference: Information explains rights and obligations of visa holders
visa_information.vevo_usage: Visa holders can use VEVO to check visa details and conditions

visa_validity.valid_until: Original expiry date given when visa was granted

holder_entitlements: Work up to 40 hours per fortnight while course is in session
Work unlimited hours during scheduled course breaks
family_member_entitlements: Eligible dependent family members can accompany the visa holder
Family members can work up to 40 hours per fortnight after the visa holder has commenced their course
Family members aged 18 or older can study for up to three months; for more than three months they must apply for their own student visa
requirements: Compliance with State and Territory workplace laws

holder_obligations: Apply for a new Student Visa (subclass 500) if changing to a course in a different education sector
Continue to satisfy SVP requirements if visa was granted under streamlined visa processing

conditions: Seeking to transfer to a different education provider not eligible under SVP (before 1 July 2016)
Transfer attempted within first 12 months of visa grant
Holder is not from a country that was Assessment Level 1 before 1 July 2016

visa_obligations.checking_conditions: Visa conditions can be checked through VEVO or the visa grant letter

requirements: Must comply with ESOS National Code requirements
restrictions: Cannot usually transfer before completing six months of the principal course unless special circumstances apply
Must obtain permission from existing education provider to transfer unless exceptions apply
process: Education provider must assess the transfer request
All providers must have documented transfer policy procedures
Students must understand transfer policy and written agreements before enrolling elsewhere

steps: Use internal appeal process of current education provider
If unsatisfied, appeal to an external complaints body such as the State or Territory Ombudsman or the Overseas Student Ombudsman

requirements: Must maintain adequate accommodation, support and welfare arrangements until age 18 or visa expiry
Cannot travel to Australia until welfare arrangements commence if arrangements are approved by education provider
students_under_18.welfare_start_reference: Welfare start date is listed on the Confirmation of Appropriate Accommodation/Welfare Arrangements (CAAW) letter
student_guardian_rules: If student guardian must leave Australia, alternative welfare arrangements must be approved first
Failure to arrange approved welfare may result in visa cancellation

no_further_stay_condition.statement: Some visas may include a 'no further stay' condition
no_further_stay_condition.implication: Cannot apply to stay in Australia beyond the specified date except in certain circumstances

family_member_obligations.requirement_summary: Dependent family members must maintain their visa conditions; breaches may result in cancellation of the primary visa

family_member_obligations.responsibility_statement: Primary visa holder is responsible for ensuring family members comply with these conditions
